p: Arsenic is known to be a traditional poison, called “ poudre de succession” (“ powder of inheritance”) in France under the reign of Louis XIV [ 73], and was also used in traditional Chinese medicine since at least 4000 years ago [ 74]. In Europe, it was part of the treatment of syphilis or other disorders in the nineteenth century [ 74]. Today, it is still widely used in industry (especially in the production of pesticides, herbicides, wood preservatives, and semiconductors) and represents a public health issue in some areas [ 74].
